titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B55
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B55

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

1.[.]rān Yuhaḥamid and [… …=] 2.rān and Nashaʾkarib and ʾAnma[r … …] 3.and Karibʿathat Yarḥab and their sons […=] 4.dān and Khalbān and Wahabʾawwām and Yuha(?)[.=] 5.m, of the lineage of Dadān, have dedicated to their patron-god 6.Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of Khaḍīʿatān of the town 7.of ʾAkinaṭ, (this) statue, as he had sought a favor from him 8.for their well-being and the well-being of their children. And [may he con-] 9.tinue to grand them healthy children and prospe[rity] 10.and soundness of mind and (material) resources [and] 11.healthy crops and harvests in 12.their land and their fields. And may he humiliate 13.their enemy and their foe. And may Taʾlab bestow upon them 14.the oracles which [they] sought [from him].

.rān Yuhaḥamid and … …=
rān and Nashaʾkarib and ʾAnmar … …
and Karibʿathat Yarḥab and their sons …=
dān and Khalbān and Wahabʾawwām and Yuha? .=
m, of the lineage of Dadān, have dedicated to their patron-god
Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of Khaḍīʿatān of the town
of ʾAkinaṭ, this statue, as he had sought a favor from him
for their well-being and the well-being of their children. And may he con-
tinue to grand them healthy children and prosperity
and soundness of mind and material resources and
healthy crops and harvests in
their land and their fields. And may he humiliate
their enemy and their foe. And may Taʾlab bestow upon them
the oracles which they sought from him.

.rān Yuhaḥamid and … …=
rān and Nashaʾkarib and ʾAnmar … …
and Karibʿathat Yarḥab and their sons …=
dān and Khalbān and Wahabʾawwām and Yuha?.=
m, of the lineage of Dadān, have dedicated to their patron-god
Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of Khaḍīʿatān of the town
of ʾAkinaṭ, this statue, as he had sought a favor from him
for their well-being and the well-being of their children. And may he con-
tinue to grand them healthy children and prosperity
and soundness of mind and material resources and
healthy crops and harvests in
their land and their fields. And may he humiliate
their enemy and their foe. And may Taʾlab bestow upon them
the oracles which they sought from him.

.rān Yuhaḥamid and … …=
rān and Nashaʾkarib and ʾAnmar … …
and Karibʿathat Yarḥab and their sons …=
dān and Khalbān and Wahabʾawwām and Yuha?.=
m, of the lineage of Dadān, have dedicated to their patron-god
Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of Khaḍīʿatān of the town
of ʾAkinaṭ, this statue, as he had sought a favor from him
for their well-being and the well-being of their children. And may he con-
tinue to grand them healthy children and prosperity
and soundness of mind and material resources and
healthy crops and harvests in
their land and their fields. And may he humiliate
their enemy and their foe. And may Taʾlab bestow upon them
the oracles which they sought from him.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
